intro: Thymus atlanticus, commonly known as Atlantic thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the coastal regions of the Atlantic coast. It features small, aromatic leaves and produces pink to purple flowers in the spring. The plant is characterized by its dense, creeping growth habit and its ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and its ability to stabilize coastal soils. The essential oils of Thymus atlanticus contain thymol and other compounds, making it valuable in traditional medicine and aromatherapy.
